node.title: New Zealand Ending Last COVID Lockdown Measures Despite Falling Short of Vaccine Goal
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern announced that the last of its Delta variant lockdowns would end and the country would transition to a new system.

node.title: U.S. Has 'Deep Concern' Over Bulgarian President Supporting Russia's Annexation of Crimea
node.description: The Crimean Peninsula is considered to be part of Ukraine by many countries around the world, but Russia continues to call it part of its own country.

node.title: Olympic Committee Accused of Supporting China 'Propaganda' After Video Call With Peng Shuai
node.description: According to the IOC's statement, Peng Shuai said in the 30-minute video call that she is doing well, appreciated the concern but asked for her privacy.

node.title: Alleged Waukesha Parade Driver Darrell Brooks Used Red SUV in Music Video
node.description: Law enforcement sources confirmed to the Associated Press that 39-year-old Darrell Brooks was taken into custody for questioning following the parade tragedy.

node.title: Harassment, a Book Deal and Nursing Homes: Read the Full Andrew Cuomo Impeachment Report
node.description: The investigation presents evidence regarding Cuomo's alleged wrongdoings during his time in office.

node.title: Christmas Tree Shortage Due to Supply Chain as Shoppers Urged to Buy Before Thanksgiving
node.description: The heatwave that scorched the U.S. last summer impacted tree farms, leading for the new plantings to not grow as much as expected.

node.title: COVID Variant That Spreads Easily, Evades Vaccines Could Have 'Severe Consequences': Study
node.description: Harvard researchers found that the worst type of variant is one that can partially evade immunity and has increased transmissibility.

node.title: Texas School District Investigating After Viral Video Shows White Student Hitting Black Teacher
node.description: "Harassment, racism, and violence against our teachers will not be tolerated," the Castleberry Independent School District said.

node.title: Xi tells ASEAN that China will not 'bully' smaller neighbours
node.description: The Philippines criticised China's recent actions in the South China Sea at a conference of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations.

node.title: Target to stay closed for Thanksgiving
node.description: Target also stayed closed on Thanksgiving last year, as a way to limit crowds during the pandemic. Now, it's keeping that tradition.

node.title: Manhattan U.S. Attorney Forms New Civil Rights Unit
node.description: Damian Williams, the first Black U.S. attorney for the Southern District of New York, noted a rise in anti-Asian and antisemitic crimes.

node.title: Grandmother group among the victims at Waukesha’s Christmas parade.
node.description: At least five people are dead after a driver plowed through a Christmas parade in a Milwaukee suburb on Sunday.

node.title: How Long Can You Keep A Frozen Turkey And How to Defrost Your Thanksgiving Bird Properly
node.description: There are at three basic ways to safely defrost a turkey, but one method can take several days to do, depending on the size of your bird.

node.title: 2 Carry Guns as Crowd Marches Through Kenosha to Protest Kyle Rittenhouse Verdict
node.description: "We just do security for different groups. We're doing a favor for them," said Erick Jordan, who carried rifles to protect protesters with his daughter Jade.

node.title: Donald Trump Responds to 'Very Sick' Waukesha Parade Incident
node.description: "The whole world is watching the tragedy which just took place in Waukesha, Wisconsin, it is devastating, horrible, and very very sick!" Trump said.

node.title: What Did Romney and Sinema’s Halloween Costumes Really Mean?
node.description: Two senators join together in some deft trolling, and absolutely infuriate a subset of TV viewers.

node.title: Target makes Thanksgiving closings permanent.
node.description: “What started as a temporary measure driven by the pandemic is now our new standard,” Brian Cornell, Target’s C.E.O., said.

node.title: Who is Lael Brainard, President Biden’s pick for the Fed’s vice chair?
node.description: She was in the mix to potentially replace Jerome Powell as Fed chair, but Mr. Biden’s decision to elevate her to the Fed’s No. 2 role will still place her in a powerful position.

node.title: Scientists Consider Creating Magnetic Field Around Mars so We Can Colonize the Red Planet
node.description: Unlike the Earth, Mars does not have a strong, global magnetic field. This field helps to protect our planet from cosmic rays and retain its atmosphere.

node.title: Man Accidentally Finds Rare 1,000-Year-Old Rock Carving While Feeding Bison
node.description: Archeologist Ernie Walker described the find at Wanuskewin Heritage Park, Saskatchewan, as "tremendously significant and very unusual."

node.title: Four Large Black Mambas Caught by Snake Catcher in One Day
node.description: Nick Evans described one of the snakes as an "immense beast," measuring over 8.5 feet, saying it was his "lucky day."

node.title: How to Help Victims of Waukesha Parade Tragedy
node.description: The United for Waukesha Community Fund was established to support the needs of the families impacted by the tragic incident at the Christmas parade.

node.title: Internet Backs Woman Not Attending Sister's Wedding If Girlfriend Not Invited
node.description: The woman claimed her sister had chosen not to allow her a +1 for her girlfriend because of the fiancé's "traditional and anti-gay" family.

node.title: Target Closing Stores on Thanksgiving Permanently, Extending Practice Started Amid COVID
node.description: Many retailers saw strong sales last year after being forced to rethink the traditional kickoff to the holiday shopping season by offering extended sale events.

node.title: More Voters Think Biden's Build Back Better Act Will Make Inflation Worse Not Better: Poll
node.description: The findings come as the White House argues the social spending package will actually reduce inflation and help cut costs for American families.

node.title: Homeless Man Stabs Shelter Employee to Death After Being Refused Entry
node.description: The shelter employee was pronounced dead just before 11 a.m. on Sunday, police said.

node.title: Teaching ‘The 1619 Project’: A Virtual Event for Educators and Librarians
node.description: Join Nikole Hannah-Jones for a candid discussion of the project and ways to share the new books “The 1619 Project: A New Origin Story” and “Born on the Water” with students.

node.title: Assembly Finds ‘Overwhelming Evidence’ Cuomo Engaged in Sexual Harassment
node.description: The New York State Assembly Judiciary Committee’s findings reinforced an earlier state attorney general’s report on former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo.

node.title: Man Loses Both Legs After Being Attacked by Brother-in-Law's Dog
node.description: Mark Day, 62, was bitten by an American Akita, bought on Facebook, on the day of his brother-in-law's funeral.

node.title: Grandma Kicked Out of Hotel After Giving 3 Star Review
node.description: The hotel manager denied removing Susan Leger, 63, and her granddaughter, because of the mediocre review.
